title: How I Handle Setbacks With Substance and Alcohol Abuse

content: Recovery -- and life as a whole -- can feel like a series of handling setbacks
Life doesn’t care if you’re in recovery or what you’re trying to heal from. It will hand you handfuls of obstacles without warning.
Even if you’ve stopped drinking or using drugs, life still shows up on a daily basis to see what you’re made of, to test your will -- to see if you really want recovery.
Just because you’ve started truly living, doesn’t mean other people will stop dying from diseases, tragedies, accidents, or natural causes.

You’ll have two choices when that happens. You can quit and give up, or simply file these tragedies in the setback category and keep moving. Find a way to keep it together or get it together and move forward.
This can sound like a tall order, but it’s simply reality as I see it.
I don’t know any other choice we have when setbacks show up in dozens on our doorsteps -- as they do, have, and will continue to.

content: In the 7 years and some change since I walked into my first 12-step meeting, I have experienced the death of more loved ones than I care to count. They died from overdoses, diseases, accidents, murders, suicides, drug addiction, alcoholism, depression, and just natural causes.
Some of these loved ones just couldn’t overcome the biggest setbacks life threw at them, so I handle mine with as much courage as I can every day, for all those who aren’t here to do so.

We do it for all those who lost their battles. I say that without judgment because nobody understands these battles better than I do. Some of us just have the same understanding because we’ve been through the setbacks and are still here.

We’ve experienced the relapses, the walkouts, the weary days, and the sleepless nights that led up to them. We’ve dealt with the fights, drama, divorces, breakups, makeups, arrests, lawyers, cops, judges, fines, jails, institutions -- and as I’ve mentioned, unfortunately, deaths.

content: However, if you’re reading this, it wasn’t your death. You’re still here. You’ve managed to bounce back from all those setbacks -- and you’re still breathing.
That, in and of itself, is a miracle worth fighting another day.

Recalling how you resolved old problems without dwelling on them will help you overcome almost any setback. How? Because the truth is that there are very few obstacles we aren’t familiar with out of necessity.
It’s so easy to forget how strong we are and how capable we are of enduring almost anything in front of us. Today, I choose to remember that strength and move forward. I hope you will join me.
